meanings.definition: Relating to a city or town, especially its administration.
meanings.sent1: The mayor attended the civic meeting to discuss city projects.
meanings.sent2: The civic center is where local government offices are located.
meanings.sent3: The civic parade featured dancing elephants and singing clowns.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to civic duty shone brightly in her volunteer work.
meanings.sent5: The civic pride in our community is evident in the well-maintained parks.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to citizenship or being a citizen.
meanings.sent1: As a civic responsibility, voting in elections is crucial.
meanings.sent2: The civic rights of individuals should be protected by the government.
meanings.sent3: The civic-minded student always helped classmates with their studies.
meanings.sent4: She wore a civic badge proudly to show her dedication to her country.
meanings.sent5: The civic engagement of the community led to positive changes in society.

meanings.definition: Concerned with the duties and activities of people in relation to their town or city.
meanings.sent1: The civic leaders organized a clean-up day for the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Civic education teaches students about their role in society.
meanings.sent3: The civic-minded group planted flowers in every pothole they found.
meanings.sent4: His civic involvement extended to coaching the local youth soccer team.
meanings.sent5: The civic spirit of the town was evident in the annual charity drive.
